oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Factors associated with morbidity, mortality and lung consolidation in preweaned dairy calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Edwards, K.Y.
Costa, J.H.C.
LeBlanc, S.J.
McNichol, A.K.
DeVries, T.J.
Steele, M.A.
Renaud, D.L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Over one-third of dairy calves will experience a preweaning ill足ness, with diarrhea and respiratory disease accounting for the majority of recorded morbidities and mortalities. Moreover, these calfhood illnesses have enduring repercussions includ足ing reduced average daily gain, delayed first conception and reduced first lactation milk yield. The objective of this retro足spective cohort study was to explore factors associated with the occurrence of diarrhea, respiratory disease (BRD), lung consoli足dation (LC) and mortality in preweaned dairy calves.
